s-1.ptxt: CHECK FOR FUEL PUMP OPERATION AND FUEL LEAKS

s2.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.

s3.ptxt: Push the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Select the Active Test and enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Fuel Pump / Speed.

s2.ptxt: Check fuel pump operation.

s3.ptxt: Check for pressure in the fuel inlet tube from the fuel line. Check that the sound of fuel flowing in the fuel tank can be heard.
If there is no sound, check the integration relay, fuel pump, ECM and wiring connector.

s2.ptxt: Check for fuel leaks.

s3.ptxt: Check that there are no fuel leaks after performing maintenance anywhere on the system.
If there are fuel leaks, repair or replace parts as necessary.

s2.ptxt: Check that the battery positive voltage is above 12 V.
Discharge the fuel system pressure (see page ).
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten2.ptxt: Wait at least 90 seconds after disconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal to prevent airbag activation.

s2.ptxt: Disconnect the No. 1 fuel hose (See page )
Install SST (pressure gauge) as shown in the illustration.
Wipe off any gasoline.
Reconnect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Operate the fuel pump.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Select the Active Test and enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Fuel Pump / Speed.

s2.ptxt: Measure the fuel pressure.

specitem.ptxt: 281 to 287 kPa (2.87 to 2.93 kgf/cm2, 41 to 42 psi)

s2.ptxt: If the pressure is higher than the specification, replace the fuel pressure regulator.
If the pressure is below the specification, check the fuel hoses, connections, fuel pump, fuel filter and fuel pressure regulator.
Start the engine.
Measure the fuel pressure.

specitem.ptxt: 281 to 287 kPa (2.87 to 2.93 kgf/cm2, 41 to 42 psi)

s2.ptxt: If the pressure is not as specified, check the fuel pump, pressure regulator and injectors.
Stop the engine.
Check that the fuel pressure remains as specified for 5 minutes after the engine has stopped.
If the pressure is not as specified, check the fuel pump, pressure regulator and injectors.
After checking the fuel pressure, disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal and carefully remove SST and the fuel tube connector to prevent gasoline from spraying.
Connect the No. 1 fuel hose (See page ).
Check for fuel leaks.

s3.ptxt: Check that there are no fuel leaks after performing maintenance anywhere on the system.
If there are fuel leaks, repair or replace parts as necessary.
